qas.question: Do incandescent light bulbs use more or less energy as compared to CFLs and LED lamps?
How much does the incandescent light ban in Europe contribute to the economy each year?
How much energy does the incandescent light ban in Europe save each year?
How much CO2 emissions does the incandescent light ban in Europe save each year?
How are laws written that bring about a ban of incandescent light bulbs?

answers.text: by setting minimum efficacy standards higher than can be achieved by incandescent lamps

qas.question: What type of light bulbs use less energy than alternatives?
What type of light source has  had measures introduced for the continued use of?
How much does the incandescent light ban in Asia contribute to the economy each year?
How much CO2 emissions does the incandescent light ban in Asia save each year?

plausible_answers.text: by setting minimum efficacy standards higher than can be achieved by incandescent lamps

qas.question: How are laws written that bring about the continued use of incandescent light bulbs?

context: Since <b5_0><b6_0>incandescent<b5_0/> light bulbs<b6_0/> use <a0_0>more<a0_0/> energy than alternatives such as CFLs and LED lamps, many governments have introduced measures to ban their use, <a4_0><b9_0>by setting minimum efficacy standards higher than can be achieved by incandescent lamps<b9_0/><a4_0/>. Measures to ban light bulbs have been implemented in the European Union, the United States, Russia, Brazil, Argentina, Canada and Australia, among others. In the Europe the EC has calculated that the ban contributes <a1_0><b7_0>5 to 10 billion euros<b7_0/><a1_0/> to the economy and saves <a2_0>40 TWh of electricity<a2_0/> every year, translating in CO2 emission reductions of <a3_0><b8_0>15 million tonnes<b8_0/><a3_0/>.
